alert.note: Alert for Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 15 at 3:21PM EST until December 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...The lower Cape Fear River including downtown Wilmington and Inland Brunswick Counties. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...US 421 North at USS North Carolina Road is flooded. River Road south of The Cape Boulevard is impassable and roads on each side of River Road south of River Road Park flood. Water Street is flooded between Red Cross Street and Orange Street and the road will be impassable. Water may spread up side streets and buildings could be affected. Point Harbor Road, US 421 Truck near Carolina Beach Road, Route 133 at Little Mallory Creek, and Old River Road at Route 133 may be impassable. Burnett Road floods at US 421. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Affected areas listed are based on average tide conditions. Additional locations may experience flooding during periods of heavy rainfall, high winds, or other factors. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Cape Fear River at Wilmington MLLW Categories - Minor 5.5 ft, Moderate 6.8 ft, Major 10.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 0.8 ft, Moderate 2.1 ft, Major 5.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/11 PM 4.5 -0.2 0.6 N/A None 16/11 AM 5.3 0.6 0.7 N/A None 17/01 AM 5.3 0.6 1.4 N/A None 17/01 PM 7.8 3.1 3.2 N/A Moderate 18/01 AM 5.1 0.4 1.1 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
